subject: feat: migrate dashboard from vanilla JS to React + Tailwind
body:
Complete migration of the dashboard from imperative vanilla JS to React:

- Add React 19, react-dom, react-chartjs-2, @vitejs/plugin-react
- Create AppContext.jsx with useReducer state management
  (replaces mutable global state object)
- Simplify index.html from 880 lines to minimal root div
- Create 20 React components:
  - App.jsx (data loading, tab routing, layout)
  - 7 shared: Header, TabBar, DropZone, FilterSidebar,
    DetailPane, SettingsPane, CollapsibleSection
  - 9 tabs: Summary, Timeline, Timing, Progress, Contributors,
    Tags, Health, Security, Discover
- Charts use react-chartjs-2 declarative components
  (replaces manual destroy/recreate lifecycle)
- Delegated event handlers eliminated
  (React onClick props replace data-* routing)
- Filter sidebar uses controlled React components
- Global state sync via useEffect (utils.js compat)
- styles.css and utils.js preserved unchanged
- Build passes, dev server runs successfully
